statement:
The *Smarandache constant* is the minimal solution $x_{\min}$ of the
generalized Andrica equation: $p_{n+1}^{x}-p_{n}^{x}=1$ where $p_n$ is
the n$^{\text{th}}$ prime number, and $x \in \mathbb{R}$. The exact
value of the Smarandache constant and whether it exists is currently
unknown, however according to the generalized Andrica conjecture
proposed by Florentin Smarandache the value of the Smarandache constant
is $x_{\min}\approx0.5671481302\ldots$

The Smarandache constant should not be confused with a list of sixteen
Smarandache constants $s_{1}-s_{16}$ defined as limits of different
convergent series involving the Smarandache function.
